docs.snippet: After losing Game 1 on Monday, the Thunder spent much of Tuesday searching for ways to beat the Spurs without Serge Ibaka, their injured starting center....
docs.lead_paragraph: After losing Game 1 on Monday, the Thunder spent much of Tuesday searching for ways to beat the Spurs without Serge Ibaka, their injured starting center.
docs.abstract: Oklahoma City Thunder continues to reel from loss of starting center Serge Ibaka, who may miss rest of postseason with strained calf; Ibaka's absence loomed over Thunder's decisive loss to the San Antonio Spurs in Game 1 of Western Conference finals.

headline.seo: Spurs Fear Return of Thunder’s Ibaka
headline.main: Even Absent, a Big Man Looms Over a Series

docs.snippet: The decision not to penalize Richard Scudamore, the chief executive of England’s Premier League, for sexist comments in his emails reveals so much about how the league views women....
docs.lead_paragraph: The decision not to penalize Richard Scudamore, the chief executive of England’s Premier League, for sexist comments in his emails reveals so much about how the league views women.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column criticizes England's Premier League for its decision not to penalize league's chief executive Richard Scudamore for sexist comments in his emails; argues that failure is in stark contrast to NBA's swift response to racist comments from Los Angeles Clippers owner Donald Sterling.

headline.main: Lesson in N.B.A. for England’s Old-Boy Network
headline.print_headline: Lesson in N.B.A. for England’s Old-Boy Network
